text: The COVID-19 pandemic was confirmed to have spread to the West Bank on 5 March 2020, beginning the COVID-19 pandemic in Palestine. ==Cases== The Palestinian health ministry said the cases had first been detected at a hotel in the Bethlehem area, where a group of Greek tourists had visited the hotel in late February. Two of them were later diagnosed with the virus. The first two cases in Gaza City, Gaza were diagnosed on 21 March. There are 20 cases as of 13 May 2020, 14 of whom have recovered as of the same date. ==Statistics== The table below shows the confirmed COVID-19 cases in the Governorates of Palestine. COVID-19 in Palestine by Governorate as of 12 May 2020 Governorate Cases Deaths Recoveries Active Cases Bethlehem Governorate 59 0 41 18 Gaza Strip 20 0 14 6 Hebron Governorate 60 0 12 48 Jenin Governorate 4 1 0 3 Jericho Governorate 1 0 1 0 Jerusalem Governorate 140 1 68 71 Nablus Governorate 7 0 4 3 Ramallah and al-Bireh Governorate 77 0 36 41 Salfit Governorate 1 0 0 1 Tulkarm Governorate 6 0 0 6 Total (12 Governorates) 375 4 176 197 ==Related pages== * COVID-19 pandemic in the Gaza Strip ==Notes== ==References== Category:History of Palestine Palestine
title: COVID-19 pandemic in Palestine
